the vehicle becomes temporary living quarters and is not to be moved.
Trailer Coach
See "Trailer".
Trailer, Fifth Wheel
See "Trailer".
Trailer, Small Utility
Any trailer drawn by a passenger automobile and used for the occasional
transport of personal effects.
Transportation Equipment Sales and Repair
A use or establishment devoted to the sale or rental of and providing minor
service for equipment for use in transporting persons or property for
substantial distances, such as buses, trucks, truck tractors, truck trailers,
chassis, reusable cargo shipping containers, aircraft, and ships.
Transportation Terminal
A use or establishment devoted solely to the storage or parking of trucks and
trailers without any goods or materials in storage facilities located on the
premises.
Truck Cab
See "Camper, Pick-Up (Slide-In)".
Truck Wash
See "Car Wash".
Truck, Trailer, and Farm Implement Sales and Service
Any business where the primary business is the sales and/or service of trucks,
trailers, and farm implements, whether new or used.
Trucking Terminal
Either end of a carrier line (e.g. a railroad, a trucking or shipping line or
an airline) with classifying yards, dock and lighterage facilities, management
offices, storage sheds and freight and passenger stations; or a freight or
passenger station that is central to a considerable area or serves as a
junction at any point with other lines.
Use
Any purpose for which a lot, building, or other structure, or a tract of land
may be designated, arranged, intended, maintained, or occupied; or any
activity, occupation, business, or operation carried on or intended to be
carried on in a building or other structure or on a tract of land.
Use, Conditional
A use, not permitted by right, that has a particular impact on the surrounding
area or neighborhood that cannot be predetermined and controlled by general
regulations. These uses are subject to the review and approval by the planning
commission. A conditional use is not considered to be a nonconforming use.
Use, Nonconforming
The use of land or a building, or a portion thereof, which does not conform to
the use regulations of the district in which it is situated.
USEPA
The United States Environmental Protection Agency.
Van, Converted or Chopped
See "Bus, Converted or Chopped".
Variance
A modification of the terms of this code where such variance will not be
contrary to the public interest and where, owing to conditions peculiar to the
property and not the result of the actions of the applicant, a literal
enforcement of this code would result in unnecessary and undue hardship.
Variance, Area
A variance of the bulk, height, area, yard, dimensional and other non-use
specifications established in this code.
Variance, Use
A variance which permits an applicant to engage in an activity or use of
property other than that permitted in the zoning district in which the property
is located.
Vehicular Use Area
Any paved ground surface area, except public rights-of-way, used by any type of
vehicle, whether moving or at rest for the following purposes, but not limited
to driving, parking, loading, unloading, storage or display.
Wall Offset
Projections or recesses organized in a random or repeating pattern along a
building wall used to visually interrupt the mass of the façade plane.
Wall Opening
Openings in a façade wall that may include windows or doors.
Warehousing and Distribution
The bulk storage of goods, for persons other than the owner of the warehouse.
Water Resources
All streams, lakes, ponds, wetlands, watercourses, waterways, drainage systems,
and all other bodies or accumulations of surface water, either natural or
artificial, which are situated wholly or partly within, or border upon this
state, or area within its jurisdictions, except those private waters which do
not combine or affect a junction with natural surface waters.
Watercourse
Any natural, perennial, or intermittent channel with a defined bed and banks,
stream, river, or brook.
Watershed
The drainage basin in which the subdivision or other area drains or that land
whose drainage is affected by the subdivision or other area.
Wetland
Those areas that are inundated or saturated by surface or ground water at a
frequency and duration sufficient to support, and that under normal
circumstances, do support a prevalence of vegetation typically adapted for life
in saturated soil conditions, including swamps, marshes, bogs, and similar
areas. Wetlands shall be delineated by a site survey and approved by the city
using delineation protocols accepted by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers and
the Ohio EPA at the time of application of this code. If a conflict exists
between the delineation protocols of these two agencies, the delineation
protocol which results in the most inclusive area of wetlands shall apply.
Wetland Setback
Those lands adjacent to wetlands where earth disturbing activities will not
take place and natural vegetation will not be removed.
Wing Wall
A wall secondary in scale projecting from a primary wall and not having a roof.
Winter
October 1st to April 1st of each year.
Wholesale Business
Commercial activity involving the transfer of title to goods, generally in
bulk, for the purpose of resale.
Yard
A required open space, unoccupied and unobstructed by any structure or portion
of a structure.
Yard, Front
A yard extending from the principal building to the front lot line and which
extends between the side lot lines.
Yard, Rear
A yard extending from the principal building to the rear lot line and which
extends between the side lot lines.
Yard, Side
A yard extending from the principal building to the side lot line on both sides
of the principal building.
Zoning Commissioner
A person appointed by the Mayor and City Council to perform the duties of the
Zoning Commissioner.
Zoning District
An area within the City of Defiance for the regulations and requirements
governing each class or kind of building or other structure or use are uniform.
The boundaries of zoning districts are shown on the zoning map.
Zoning Map
The Official Zoning Map of the City of Defiance.
Zoning Map Amendment
An amendment or change to the Official Zoning Map of the City of Defiance
reviewed and decided upon by the city council in accordance with Section
1165.03 Zoning Text and Map Amendments.
Zoning Permit
A permit issued by the Zoning Commissioner stating that the proposed erection,
construction, enlargement or use of a building, structure or premises referred
to therein complies with the provisions of this code.
Zoning Text Amendment
An amendment or change to the text of this code reviewed and decided upon by
the city council in accordance with Section
1165.03 Zoning Text and Map Amendments
(Ord. 8592. Passed 7-2-24.)

1311.01 DEFINITION OF "STRUCTURE".
   Unless otherwise specifically and expressly defined within an individual
chapter of Part Thirteen of the Codified Ordinances, the word "structure" as
used in Part Thirteen of the Codified Ordinances, means anything constructed or
erected, the use of which requires a fixed location on the ground or attachment
to something having a fixed location on the ground and includes, but is not
limited to: buildings, dwellings, dwelling units, rooming units, industrialized
units, manufactured housing units, fences, billboards and other signs, and
further includes facilities and appurtenances constructed or installed to
promote the utilization of buildings, dwellings, dwelling units, rooming units,
industrialized units and manufactured housing units including, without
limitation: driveways; sidewalks; storm water drainage grading and conduits;
sanitary sewerage facilities; water, electric energy and natural gas
transmission facilities and connections.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1311.02 BUILDING AND ZONING COMMISSIONER.
   Part Thirteen of the Codified Ordinances, and all titles, chapters and
sections thereof, shall be administered by the Building and Zoning Commissioner
and such assistants as may be authorized by Council. The Building and Zoning
Commissioner shall possess and maintain all professional qualifications
required of the "principal building code official" of a municipal building
department that is certified by the Ohio Board of Building Standards to
administer the Ohio Building Code.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1311.03 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall:
   (a)    Administer Chapter
1313 of the Codified Ordinances and grant or deny the issuance of and revoke
Certificates of Registration in accordance with the requirements thereof;
   (b)    Accept and approve plans and specifications, issue permits, make
inspections and exercise all enforcement authority conferred by the Ohio
Building Code, the Ohio Residential Code for One, Two and Three Family
Dwellings, the Permanent Foundations Guide for Manufactured Housing and any
other technical code adopted by Ordinance and issue Certificates of Compliance
in conformity with the requirements of Section
1331.04 of the Codified Ordinances;
   (c)    Accept and approve plans and specifications, issue permits, make
inspections and exercise all enforcement authority conferred by Chapter
1333 of the Codified Ordinances;
   (d)    Investigate allegations of nuisance and non-compliance with minimum
housing standards established by Chapter
1335 of the Codified Ordinances and, in the event of a violation, issue a
Notice and Order to the owner and occupant of the deficient premises in
accordance with Section
1311.05;
   (e)    Accept and approve plans and specifications, issue permits, make
inspections and exercise all enforcement authority conferred by Chapter
1337 of the Codified Ordinances;
   (f)    Investigate allegations of nuisance and non-compliance with minimum
maintenance standards established by Chapter
1339 of the Codified Ordinances and, in the event of a violation, issue a
Notice and Order to the owner and occupant of the deficient premises in
accordance with Section
1311.05;
   (g)    Identify the existence of unsafe structures and issue an Order to
Vacate or Demolish the premises in accordance with Section
1311.05;
   (h)    Accept and approve plans and specifications, issue permits, make
inspections and administer Chapter
1341 of the Codified Ordinances and investigate allegations of nuisance and
noncompliance with minimum maintenance standards established by Chapter
1341 of the Codified Ordinances and, in the event of a violation, issue a
Notice and Order to the owner and occupant of the deficient premises in
accordance with Section
1311.05;
   (i)    Accept, on behalf of the Rehabilitation Board of Review, applications
for Certificates of Appropriateness filed in accordance with Chapter
1351 of the Codified Ordinances, review the sufficiency of the documentation
and information filed in support of such application and make recommendations
to the Board concerning the sufficiency of such information;
   (j)   Assure that all Certificates of Appropriateness required by Chapter
1353 of the Codified Ordinances have been issued prior to the issuance of any
permit authorizing the construction, alteration or demolition of any structure
to which such chapter applies.
      (Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1311.04 INSPECTIONS.
   The Building and Zoning Commissioner and all duly appointed assistants
acting under the supervision of the Building and Zoning Commissioner are
authorized to enter upon any premises and into any building, dwelling or other
structure for the purpose of conducting inspections reasonably required by or
appropriate to the discharge of the duties enumerated in Section
1311.03 of the Codified Ordinances in accordance with general laws governing
the conduct of administrative inspections.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1311.05 ENFORCEMENT PROCEDURES.
   (a)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall grant or deny permits,
issue stop work Orders and take other enforcement action in conformity with and
utilizing the procedures provided for by the Ohio Building Code in connection
with the approval of all work to which the Code applies. Appeals of any
determination made by the Commissioner shall be directed to the Ohio Board of
Building Appeals.
   (b)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall grant or deny permits,
issue stop work Orders and take other enforcement action in conformity with the
Ohio Residential Code for One, Two and Three Family Dwellings in connection
with the approval of all work to which the Code applies and, in doing so,
shall, to the extent practicable, utilize the document forms and procedures
established by the Ohio Building Code for like-kind activities in connection
with work governed by the Ohio Building Code. Appeals of any determination made
by the Commissioner shall be directed to the Board of Zoning and Building
Appeals.
   (c)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall grant or deny permits,
issue stop work Orders and take other enforcement action in conformity with the
Permanent Foundations Guide for Manufactured Housing in connection with the
approval of all work to which the Guide applies and, in doing so, shall, to the
extent practicable, utilize the document forms and procedures established by
the Ohio Building Code for like-kind activities in connection with work
governed by the Ohio Building Code. Appeals of any determination made by the
Commissioner shall be directed to the Board of Zoning and Building Appeals.
   (d)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall grant or deny permits,
issue stop work Orders and take other enforcement action authorized or required
by Chapter
1333 of the Codified Ordinances in conformity with the procedures set out in
said Chapter
1333 and, in doing so, shall, utilize document forms and procedures recommended
or approved by the Ohio Department of Natural Resources or Federal Emergency
Management Agency. In the absence of such recommended or approved document
forms or procedures, the Commissioner shall, to the extent practicable, utilize
the document forms and procedures established by the Ohio Building Code for
like-kind activities in connection with work governed by the Ohio Building
Code. Appeals of any determination made by the Commissioner shall be directed
to the Board of Zoning and Building Appeals.
   (e)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall grant or deny permits,
issue stop work Orders and take other enforcement action authorized or required
by Chapters
1337 and
1341 of the Codified Ordinances in conformity with the requirements of said
chapters and, in doing so, shall, to the extent practicable, utilize the
document forms and procedures established by the Ohio Building Code for like-
kind activities in connection with work governed by the Ohio Building Code.
Appeals of any determination made by the Commissioner shall be directed to the
Board of Zoning and Building Appeals.
   (f)   In all cases in which the Building and Zoning Commissioner has
knowledge of the existence of housing conditions that fail to meet the minimum
standards established by Section
1335.02 of the Codified Ordinances, of the existence of a structure that has
not been maintained in conformity with the requirements of Chapter
1339 or of land that has not been maintained in conformity with the
requirements of Chapter
1341, the Commissioner shall issue a Notice and Order to all owners of record
of the real estate on which such conditions exist. The Notice and Order shall
itemize all conditions requiring correction and order remedial action that, if
taken, will conform the property to the requirements of this Building Code. The
Notice and Order shall specify a reasonable time within which the remedial
action is to be completed and advise the owner of the procedure for Appeal. The
Notice and Order shall be deemed served at the time of delivery to each person
entitled thereto by any means authorized for the service of summons in a Civil
Action by Rule 4 of the Ohio Rules of Civil Procedure. Appeal of any Order made
by the Commissioner shall be directed to the Board of Zoning and Building
Appeals.
   (g)    In all cases in which the Building and Zoning Commissioner has
knowledge of the existence of a dangerous structure as defined by Section
1339.04 of the Codified Ordinances he shall issue a Notice and Order conforming
to the requirements of subsection (f) hereof to all owners of record of the
real estate on which such conditions exist. The remedial action Ordered by such
Notice and Order shall be demolition of the dangerous structure within the time
allowed by the Notice and Order when, in the opinion of the Commissioner, the
structure cannot be repaired so that it will conform to the requirements of
this Building and Housing Code or that the cost to correct all conditions
itemized in the Notice and Order will exceed fifty percent of the value of the
structure. In all cases in which the Notice and Order issued pursuant to this
section includes an Order requiring demolition of the structure, a copy of the
Notice and Order shall be served upon all persons holding a valid mortgage
against the premises in any manner authorized for service upon an owner of the
property. Appeal of any Order made by the Commissioner shall be directed to the
Board of Zoning and Building Appeals.
   (h)    Whenever the Building and Zoning Commissioner determines that a
structure is a dangerous structure and that continued occupancy or use thereof
constitutes an imminent threat to human life or health, he shall order the
premises, or so much thereof as are deemed dangerous, vacated and shall
conspicuously post on the structure, and on any lands surrounding the structure
rendered dangerous by the condition of the structure, placards clearly stating
that the structure and any surrounding grounds so posted are unfit for use and
prohibiting entry by any person other than those engaged in the repair or
demolition of the structure.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1311.06 FEES AND CHARGES.
   (a)    By Resolution duly adopted in public meeting, the Board of Control
shall establish, and from time to time may amend, a schedule of fees to be
charged and collected at the time application is made for the issuance of any
license, certificate of registration, certificate of compliance or permit
granted by the Building and Zoning Commissioner.
   (b)    All fees established pursuant to subsection (a) hereof shall be
reasonably related to the actual cost of administration of the Building Code
and shall be subject to the following limitations:
      (1)   Fees established for permits issued under the authority of the Ohio
Building Code shall not exceed the amount established by the Ohio Board of
Building Standards for plan review, permit issuance and inspection of like-kind
work by officials of the State of Ohio engaged in the administration of the
Ohio Building Code.
      (2)   Fees established for permits issued under the authority of the Ohio
Residential Code for One, Two and Three Family Dwellings, the Permanent
Foundations Guide for Manufactured Housing or other technical codes adopted by
Ordinance shall not exceed the amount established by the Ohio Board of Building
Standards for comparable services performed by officials of the State of Ohio
in connection with the administration of the Ohio Building Code.
      (3)   Fees established for the issuance or renewal of a Certificate of
Registration as a contractor shall be uniform in amount regardless of the type
of Registration sought or the amount of time remaining before the Certificate
issued will be subject to renewal and shall not exceed one hundred fifty
dollars ($150.00); provided, however, that in the event an examination is given
to ascertain the extent of an applicant's knowledge of construction principals
relevant to work of the type authorized by the Certificate of Registration for
which application is made, the actual cost incurred by the municipality for the
administration and grading of such examination shall be paid by the applicant
in addition to the fee otherwise required by the Resolution of the Board of
Control.
         (Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1311.07 FEE SURCHARGE FOR DELAYED APPLICATIONS.
   (a)   In the event any person commences work for which a permit is required
by this Building Code or by any technical code adopted by ordinance without
first securing such permit, the charge otherwise established for that permit in
accordance with Section
1311.06 shall be increased by one hundred percent (100%).
 
   (b)   In the event any person completes work for which a permit is required
by this Building Code or by any technical code adopted by ordinance without
first securing such permit, the charge otherwise established for that permit in
accordance with Section
1311.06 shall be increased by two hundred percent (200%).
 
   (c)   In the event any person undertakes work for which a permit is required
by this Building Code or by any technical code adopted by ordinance and
conceals such work in a manner that impedes the proper inspection thereof, the
charge otherwise established in accordance with Section
1311.06 for the permit pursuant to which the work is undertaken shall be
increased by a surcharge of fifty dollars ($50.00). In the event uncovering the
work or other extraordinary measures required to verify Building Code
compliance require the presence of an inspector at the site of the construction
for more than thirty minutes, the surcharge imposed by this subsection shall be
increased by twenty-five dollars ($25.00) for each additional quarter hour the
inspector remains at the construction site.
 
   (d)   The imposition of a permit fee surcharge pursuant to this section is
to off-set the increased administrative and inspection costs customarily
incurred because of the untimely filing of an application for a building permit
or concealment of permitted work prior to inspection and does not constitute a
civil forfeiture or criminal penalty. The collection of such surcharge shall
not affect the validity of any criminal prosecution predicated on the unlawful
performance of work without a valid permit nor any administrative proceeding
commenced to revoke the registration of a contractor. (Ord. 6838. Passed 8-7-
07.)
1311.08 CRIMINAL PROHIBITIONS.
   (a)    No person shall remove or deface any placard affixed to property
pursuant to Section
1311.05(h).
 
   (b)    No person shall enter any land or structure that has been ordered
vacated and to which a placard has been attached pursuant to Section
1311.05(h) of this Chapter.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1311.99 PENALTIES.
   (a)    Violation of Section
1311.08(a) of the Codified Ordinances constitutes a misdemeanor offense of the
first degree.
 
   (b)    Violation of Section
1311.08(b) of the Codified Ordinances constitutes a misdemeanor offense of the
third degree.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)

1313.01 BUILDING CONTRACTORS.
   No person, corporation, partnership or other business association shall
construct, erect, repair, alter or demolish any building or other structure or
advertise him, her or itself as being available for the performance of such
work within the City unless such person, corporation, partnership or business
association has been issued a certificate of registration as a Building
Contractor by the Building and Zoning Commissioner.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.02 ELECTRICAL CONTRACTORS.
   No person, corporation, partnership or other business association shall
install, maintain, alter or repair any electric wiring, device, appliance or
equipment or advertise him, her or itself as being available for the
performance of such work within the City unless such person, corporation,
partnership or business association has been issued a certificate of
registration as an Electrical Contractor by the Building and Zoning
Commissioner.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.03 HYDRONICS CONTRACTORS.
   No person, corporation, partnership or other business association shall
undertake to perform any work or advertise him, her or itself as being
available for the performance of any work within the City for which a License
as a Hydronics Contractor is required by Chapter 4740 of the Revised Code
unless such person, corporation, partnership or business association has been
issued a certificate of registration as a Hydronics Contractor by the Building
and Zoning Commissioner.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.04 MECHANICAL CONTRACTORS.
   No person, corporation, partnership or other business association shall
install, maintain, alter or repair any heating or air conditioning apparatus or
advertise him, her or itself as being available for the performance of such
work within the City unless such person, corporation, partnership or business
association has been issued a certificate of registration as a Mechanical
Contractor by the Building and Zoning Commissioner.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.05 REFRIGERATION CONTRACTORS.
   No person, corporation, partnership or other business association shall
undertake to perform any work or advertise him, her or itself as being
available for the performance of any work within the City for which a License
as a Refrigeration Contractor is required by Chapter 4740 of the Revised Code
unless such person, corporation, partnership or business association has been
issued a certificate of registration as a Refrigeration Contractor by the
Building and Zoning Commissioner.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.06 PLUMBING CONTRACTORS.
   No person, corporation, partnership or other business association shall
install, maintain, alter or repair any plumbing apparatus or advertise him, her
or itself as being available for the performance of such work within the City
unless such person, corporation, partnership or business association has been
issued a certificate of registration as a Plumbing Contractor by the Building
and Zoning Commissioner.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.07 SIGN CONTRACTORS.
   No person, corporation, partnership or other business association shall
erect, enlarge, repair, move or maintain any sign or advertise him, her or
itself as being available for the performance of such work within the City
unless such person, corporation, partnership or business association has been
issued a certificate of registration as a Sign Contractor by the Building and
Zoning Commissioner.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.08 EXEMPTIONS FROM REGISTRATION.
   (a)    Any person employed by and working under the direction of a person,
corporation, partnership or other business association to whom a contractor's
certificate of registration has been issued is exempted from the requirements
of this chapter for all work within the scope of his or her employment that is
authorized by the certificate or certificates issued to the person's employer.
   (b)    The owner of a single family dwelling house may carry out any work
governed by this Building Code without a certificate of registration otherwise
required by this chapter; provided such owner:
      (1)   Maintains his or her principal residence on the premises where such
work is performed;
      (2)   Obtains an permit for all work undertaken; and,
      (3)   Refrains from all use of any improvement constructed or installed
until the work has been inspected and found to be in compliance with all
applicable provisions of the Ohio Residential Code for One, Two and Three
Family Dwellings, the Permanent Foundations Guide for Manufactured Housing and
any other technical codes adopted by Ordinance.
         (Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.09 APPLICATIONS FOR REGISTRATION.
   Applications for registration as a Contractor shall be made on forms
prescribed by the Building and Zoning Commissioner. Said forms shall require
disclosure of:
   (a)    The name, address, telephone number and tax identification number of
the applicant;
   (b)    If the applicant is a corporation, the names, business address and
business telephone number of all officers;
   (c)    If the applicant is a partnership or other unincorporated business
association, the names, business address and business telephone number of all
general partners or other principals;
   (d)    The name of all individuals employed by the applicant who are
authorized to obtain permits in the name of the applicant;
   (e)    Satisfactory evidence that the applicant for registration has filed
all documents ordinarily and customarily required in connection with the
administration of the municipal Income Tax Ordinance with the City Finance
Department, Income Tax Division;
   (f)    Satisfactory evidence of insurance coverage required by Section
1313.10 of this chapter;
   (g)    Satisfactory evidence of qualifications fulfilling the minimum
requirements of Section
1313.11 of this chapter.
      (Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.10 INSURANCE REQUIREMENTS.
   The application for any Certificate of Registration issued under this
chapter shall be accompanied by certificates of insurance evidencing:
   (a)    The existence of contractor's liability insurance providing complete
operations coverage and, standing alone or in combination with one or more
policies of excess liability or umbrella coverage, providing a combined single
limit of coverage for bodily injuries, deaths and property losses occasioned by
the occurrence of any insured event of not less than one million dollars
($1,000,000), together with a valid commitment from each of the applicant's
insurance carrier(s), all of which must be authorized to do business in the
State, that the Municipality shall be given ten days' written notice before
cancellation, lapsing or voiding of any such policy; and,
   (b)    Compliance with all applicable requirements of the Ohio Worker's
Compensation laws.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.11 MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS.
   (a)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall issue a Certificate of
Registration as a Building Contractor or Sign Contractor to any applicant for
registration who presents satisfactory evidence that the applicant is
reasonably qualified by training or experience to engage in work of the type
authorized by the certificate. The following shall constitute prima facie
evidence that the applicant is reasonably qualified:
      (1)   Possession of a Certificate of Registration of the type sought
previously issued to the applicant by the City of Defiance and in good standing
on the date application for renewal thereof is made;
      (2)   Possession of a current, valid Certificate of Registration,
License, Permit or similar authorization to engage in work of the type
authorized by the certificate of registration that has been issued to the
applicant by a local governmental building authority certified by the Ohio
Board of Building Standards to administer and enforce the Ohio Building Code
within the territorial jurisdiction of the political subdivision in which the
applicant maintains his, her or its principal place of business;
      (3)   Proof that the applicant is currently eligible to enter into
contract with the Ohio Department of Transportation or the Ohio Department of
Administrative Services for performance of work of the type authorized by the
Certificate of Registration;
      (4)   An experience statement submitted by the applicant under oath
attesting to the applicant's vocational training and/or work experience that,
in the opinion of the Building and Zoning Commissioner, evidences that the
applicant is reasonably qualified by such training or experience to engage in
work of the type authorized by the certificate of registration;
      (5)   Satisfactory performance on an examination administered at the
direction of the Building and Zoning Commissioner to ascertain the extent of
the applicant's knowledge of construction principals relevant to work of the
type authorized by the Certificate of Registration.
   (b)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall issue a Certificate of
Registration as an Electrical Contractor to any applicant for registration who
presents satisfactory evidence that the applicant has been issued a License as
an Electrical Contractor by the Ohio Construction Industry Examining Board. No
proof of qualifications other than the possession of a valid and unexpired
license issued in accordance with Chapter 4740 of the Revised Code and
regulations of the Ohio Department of Commerce promulgated pursuant thereto
shall be deemed sufficient.
   (c)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall issue a Certificate of
Registration as a Hydronics Contractor to any applicant for registration who
presents satisfactory evidence that the applicant has been issued a License as
a Hydronics Contractor by the Ohio Construction Industry Examining Board. No
proof of qualifications other than the possession of a valid and unexpired
license issued in accordance with Chapter 4740 of the Revised Code and
regulations of the Ohio Department of Commerce promulgated pursuant thereto
shall be deemed sufficient.
   (d)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall issue a Certificate of
Registration as a Mechanical Contractor to any applicant for registration who
presents satisfactory evidence that the applicant has been issued a License as
a Heating, Ventilating and Air Conditioning Contractor by the Ohio Construction
Industry Examining Board. No proof of qualifications other than the possession
of a valid and unexpired license issued in accordance with Chapter 4740 of the
Revised Code and regulations of the Ohio Department of Commerce promulgated
pursuant thereto shall be deemed sufficient.
   (e)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall issue a Certificate of
Registration as a Refrigeration Contractor to any applicant for registration
who presents satisfactory evidence that the applicant has been issued a License
as a Refrigeration Contractor by the Ohio Construction Industry Examining
Board. No proof of qualifications other than the possession of a valid and
unexpired license issued in accordance with Chapter 4740 of the Revised Code
and regulations of the Ohio Department of Commerce promulgated pursuant thereto
shall be deemed sufficient.
   (f)    The Building and Zoning Commissioner shall issue a Certificate of
Registration as a Plumbing Contractor to any applicant for registration who
presents satisfactory evidence that the applicant has been issued a License as
a Plumbing Contractor by the Ohio Construction Industry Examining Board. No
proof of qualifications other than the possession of a valid and unexpired
license issued in accordance with Chapter 4740 of the Revised Code and
regulations of the Ohio Department of Commerce promulgated pursuant thereto
shall be deemed sufficient.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.12 EFFECT OF REGISTRATION CERTIFICATE.
   The issuance of a Certificate of Registration under this chapter signifies
only that the applicant has complied with the registration requirements of this
chapter and does not constitute a representation by the Municipality concerning
the quality of work that may be expected of the holder of such Certificate. No
holder of any Certificate of Registration issued under this chapter shall
represent to any person that the possession of such Certificate attests to the
holder's, honesty, integrity or competency. Misrepresentation of such
Certificate of Registration as a municipal endorsement of the Holder's goods or
services shall result in revocation of such Certificate. (Ord. 6223. Passed 6-
12-01.)
1313.13 TERM OF REGISTRATION; RENEWAL.
   Certificates of Registration as a Contractor shall expire on December 31
each year. Applications for the renewal of an expiring Certificate may be made
on and after December 1. Applications for renewal shall be made on forms
prescribed by the Building and Zoning Commissioner and shall be supported by
evidence that all insurance coverages required by this Chapter are in force on
the date of renewal and that such coverage has been maintained without
interruption since the date on which the expiring Certificate of Registration
was issued.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.14 REVOCATION OF CERTIFICATES.
   The Building and Zoning Commissioner may revoke any Certificate of
Registration issued under this chapter upon a finding that the Holder thereof
has:
   (a)    Misrepresented any material fact in obtaining the Certificate or in
securing a previous renewal thereof;
   (b)    Permitted the Certificate of Registration to be used to obtain a
permit for the performance of work knowing that such work is to be performed by
one other than the Holder of the Certificate;
   (c)    Represented to any person that the issuance or possession of such
Certificate attests to the Holder's honesty, integrity or competency or
provides assurance that goods to be furnished or services to be performed by
the Holder will be of a certain quality;
   (d)    Commenced work for which a permit is required without obtaining such
permit;
   (e)    Concealed work with purpose to prevent or impede the proper
inspection thereof;
   (f)    Failed to correct deficient work within the time specified by a
lawfully issued notice of code violation or noncompliance;
   (g)    Failed to perform work undertaken within the City without
justification;
   (h)    Failed to honor any written warranty or guarantee made in connection
with work undertaken within the City;
   (i)    Failed to maintain insurance coverage required by this chapter;
   (j)   Secured or solicited a contract for the performance of work by
knowingly misrepresenting the anticipated labor costs to be incurred or by
knowingly misrepresenting the specifications of the materials to be used in the
performance of such contract.
   Notice of revocation shall be served upon the Holder of the Certificate in
writing. Such action shall be subject to appeal to the Board of Building and
Zoning Appeals by filing a Notice of Appeal with the Building and Zoning
Commissioner within five days following service of such Notice. (Ord. 6223.
Passed 6-12-01.)
1313.15 AUTOMATIC REVOCATION OF CERTIFICATES.
   Certificates of Registration issued to any Electrical, Hydronics,
Mechanical, Refrigeration or Plumbing Contractor shall be valid only for so
long as the Holder thereof possesses a valid license as a specialty contractor
to engage in the type of work authorized by the Certificate issued by the Ohio
Construction Industry Examining Board. Suspension, expiration, non-renewal or
other lapse of such license shall result in immediate revocation of the
Certificate of Registration without further notice to the registrant.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
 
1313.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    Whoever engages in work for which a Certificate of Registration is
required by this chapter without first obtaining such Certificate is guilty of
a misdemeanor of the fourth degree.
   (b)    Whoever engages in work for which a Certificate of Registration is
required by this chapter knowing that such Certificate has been revoked is
guilty of a misdemeanor of the first degree. (Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
CHAPTER 1315
Board of Zoning and Building Appeals
1315.01   Jurisdiction.
1315.02   Commencement of appeal.
1315.03   Assignment for hearing.
1315.04   Conduct of hearings on appeal.
1315.05   Discretion vested in the Board of Zoning and Building Appeals.
1315.06   Determinations of the Board of Zoning and Building Appeals.
1315.07   Effect of pending of appeal.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Board established - see CHTR. Sec.
7.03
Appeals from administrative agencies - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 2506
 
1315.01 JURISDICTION.
   (a)    The Board of Zoning and Building Appeals shall have jurisdiction to
review, reverse, modify or affirm the determination of the Building and Zoning
Commissioner to:
      (1)    Deny the issuance of or to revoke a Certificate of Registration
pursuant to Chapter
1313 of the Codified Ordinances;
      (2)   Deny the issuance of any permit required for the lawful performance
of work or to issue a stop work Order pursuant to subsections (b), (c), (d) or
(e) of Section
1311.05 of the Codified Ordinances;
      (3)    Deny the issuance of a Certificate of Compliance required by
Section
1331.04 of the Codified Ordinances for lawful occupancy of any building or
other structure;
      (4)    Order remedial action pursuant to subsection (f) or (g) of Section
1311.05.
   (b)    All proceedings in appeal of any action taken by the Commissioner
pursuant to Part Thirteen of the Codified Ordinances shall be conducted in
conformity with the procedural requirements of this chapter except:
      (1)   Proceedings in appeal of any action taken by the Commissioner
pursuant to Chapter
1333 shall, to the extent that such provisions are irreconcilably inconsistent
with the requirements of this chapter, be conducted in conformity with the
procedural requirements of Chapter
1333 and the exercise of discretion by the Board shall be subject to the
limitations. expressed in that chapter; and,
      (2)    Proceedings in appeal of any action taken by the Commissioner
pursuant to Chapter
1337 shall, to the extent that such provisions are irreconcilably inconsistent
with the requirements of this chapter, be conducted in conformity with the
procedural requirements of Chapter
1337 and the exercise of discretion by the Board shall be subject to the
limitations expressed in that chapter.
         (Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1315.02 COMMENCEMENT OF APPEAL.
   (a)    Appeals shall be commenced by the filing of a written Notice of
Appeal with the Clerk of the Board of Building and Zoning Appeals. The Notice
shall:
      (1)    Set forth the name, address and telephone number of the appellant;
      (2)    Identify the permit or certificate denied or revoked or the Stop
Work Order or Order for remedial action to be appealed;
      (3)    A statement of the error alleged in the action of the Commissioner
or the grounds asserted in mitigation or as justification for amendment or
reversal of the Order.
   (b)    The Notice of Appeal shall be filed within ten days following the
date on which issuance of the permit or certificate sought is denied or within
ten days following service on the appellant of the notice of revocation of
registration, stop work order or Notice and Order to remedy deficiencies from
which appeal is taken. Failure to timely file the Notice of Appeal shall render
the action of the Commissioner final.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1315.03 ASSIGNMENT FOR HEARING.
   Upon receipt of a Notice of Appeal, the Clerk of the Board of Zoning and
Building Appeals shall assign the appeal for hearing at the next regularly
scheduled meeting of the Board to be convened more than ten days following the
date on which the Notice of Appeal is received. Notice of the time and place
assigned for hearing shall be delivered to the Appellant and the Building and
Zoning Commissioner. The conduct of the hearing shall be included in the agenda
prepared for the regular meeting of the Board at which the appeal will be
heard. No other public notification of the time or place assigned for the
conduct of the hearing shall be required.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1315.04 CONDUCT OF HEARINGS ON APPEAL.
    All proceedings and deliberations of the Board shall be conducted in public
session. The appellant and Commissioner shall present such evidence as the
Board deems relevant to the issues raised by the Notice of Appeal and may
exercise the subpoena powers of the Board to compel the attendance of any
witness. The appellant, Commissioner and such witnesses as are called may, in
the Board's discretion, be examined under oath but the absence of sworn
testimony shall not invalidate any determination made by the Board.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1315.05 DISCRETION VESTED IN THE BOARD OF ZONING AND BUILDING APPEALS.
   The Board of Zoning and Building Appeals shall consider all questions of Law
and Fact presented and determine whether the Appellant is entitled to:
   (a)    To the issuance of any permit, certificate of registration or
certificate of compliance denied by the Commissioner;
   (b)    Reinstatement of any certificate of registration revoked by the
Commissioner;
   (c)    Withdrawal of any Stop Work Order issued by the Commissioner;
placed in issue by the information set forth in the Notice of Appeal. Where the
appeal challenges the propriety of any Notice and Order issued by the
Commissioner, the Board shall determine whether the building, dwelling or other
structure is, in fact, in the condition alleged by the Notice and Order and
whether such condition constitutes a violation of the provision or provisions
of the Building Code recited in the Notice and Order. The Board may further
consider the intent of this Building Code and, where it clearly appears that
undue hardship would result from a literal application of any provision of this
Building Code by reason of special conditions or circumstances unique to the
structure, the Board may permit a variance from the applicable section if,
notwithstanding such variance, the structure will comply with the spirit and
intent of this Building Code with respect to sanitation, safety and
rehabilitation. All decisions to permit a variance shall require affirmative
approval of a majority of the total membership of the Board.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1315.06 DETERMINATIONS OF THE BOARD OF ZONING AND BUILDING APPEALS.
   (a)    The Board shall decide all appeals within thirty days after the final
hearing thereon. The Board may reverse or affirm, wholly or partly, or modify,
the order, requirement, decision or determination appealed from, and shall make
such order, requirement, decision or determination as in its opinion ought to
be made in the premises, and to that end shall have all powers of the Building
and Zoning Commissioner from whom the appeal is taken. The findings and
decisions of the Board and reasons therefor shall be summarized and reduced to
writing and entered as a matter of public record in the office of the Building
and Zoning Commissioner.
   (b)    A copy of the Board's decision shall be transmitted to the petitioner
and the Building and Zoning Commissioner. The decision shall be binding upon
the Building and Zoning Commissioner and he or she shall incorporate the terms
and conditions of the same in any permit, certificate or order subsequently
issued to the appellant.
   (c)   The decision of the Board shall become final five days following the
date on which the determination is filed of Record in the office of the
Building and Zoning Commissioner unless the Board finds that an immediate
effective date is necessary for the preservation of property or personal
rights, and so certifies on the record.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1315.07 EFFECT OF PENDING OF APPEAL.
   The filing of a Notice of Appeal shall stay enforcement of any Order to
remedy deficiencies set forth in the Notice and Order from which appeal is
taken but shall not:
   (a)    Authorize the performance of any work for which a permit is required;
   (b)    Suspend enforcement of any stop work order;
   (c)    Authorize the performance of any work for which registration as a
contractor is required; or
   (d)    Authorize entry into any structure or upon any premises to which a
placard has been affixed pursuant to Section
1311.05(h) of the Codified Ordinances.
      (Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
CHAPTER 1316
Judicial Remedies
1316.01   Declaration of nuisance.
1316.02   Actions to abate nuisance authorized.
1316.03   Criminal penalties.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Nuisances, dangerous premises and abatement - see BLDG. Ch.
1317
 
1316.01 DECLARATION OF NUISANCE.
   Any land or structure with respect to which an Notice and Order to remedy
conditions has been issued that remains out of compliance with the requirements
of that Notice and Order after the date by which remediation is required by the
terms of the Notice and Order, or by any modification thereof granted by the
Board of Zoning and Building Appeals constitutes a public nuisance.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1316.02 ACTIONS TO ABATE NUISANCE AUTHORIZED.
   The Law Director is authorized to commence Judicial proceedings for
injunctive or other appropriate relief to abate any condition declared to be a
public nuisance by Section
1316.01 of the Codified Ordinances.
(Ord. 6223. Passed 6-12-01.)
1316.03 CRIMINAL PENALTIES.
   (a)   No owner or occupant of land shall cause or permit any condition
declared to be a public nuisance by Section
1316.01 to be maintained thereon.
   (b)   Violation of subsection (a) hereof constitutes and shall be punished
as a minor misdemeanor.
   (c)   Violation of subsection (a) hereof by any person who has previously
been convicted of a violation of subsection (a) hereof constitutes and shall be
punished as a misdemeanor of the fourth degree.
   (d)   Violation of subsection (a) hereof by any person who has been
convicted of a violation of subsection (a) hereof on more than one prior
occasion constitutes and shall be punished as a misdemeanor of the third
degree.
(Ord. 6419. Passed 9-23-03.)
